Text: Fen:  They are characterised by their distinct water chemistry, which is pH neutral or alkaline, with relatively high dissolved mineral levels but few other plant nutrients.
Triplets:<Fen

Text: Fen:  They are usually dominated by grasses and sedges, and typically have brown mosses in general including "Scorpidium" or "Drepanocladus".
Triplets:<Fen

Text: Fen:  They may also occur along large lakes and rivers where seasonal changes in water level maintain wet soils with few woody plants.
Triplets:<Fen

Text: Fen:  The distribution of individual species of fen plants is often closely connected to water regimes and nutrient concentrations.
